qas.question: According to the 2000 United States Census, how many people were living in Atlantic City?
According to the 2000 United States Census, what was the population density?
According to the 2000 United States Census, how many housing units were there in Atlantic City?
According to the 2000 United States Census, what percentage of the population of Atlantic City were Hispanic or Latino?
According to the 2000 United States Census, what percentage of the population of Atlantic City were white?

context: As of the 2000 United States Census there were <a0_0>40,517<a0_0/> people, 15,848 households, and 8,700 families residing in the city. The population density was <a1_0>3,569.8 people per square mile<a1_0/> (1,378.3/km2). There were <a2_0>20,219<a2_0/> housing units at an average density of 1,781.4 per square mile (687.8/km2). The racial makeup of the city was 44.16% black or African American, <a4_0>26.68%<a4_0/> White, 0.48% Native American, 10.40% Asian, 0.06% Pacific Islander, 13.76% other races, and 4.47% from two or more races. <a3_0>24.95%<a3_0/> of the population were Hispanic or Latino of any race. 19.44% of the population was non-Hispanic whites.
